text:
The label attribute in the XML files generated by JMeter contains the URL
instead of the mane of the sampler. This makes *REALLY* difficult to separate
the metrics of different methods of the same web service, since they all share
the same url.
Could it be possible to give the user the option to choose the name printed in
the label attribute? It's just a matter to remove or comment out all the
instances of setSampleLabel(url) in the WebServiceSampler.java and
HTTPSampler.java, since they both inherit from HTTPSamplerBase.java, which
behaves correctly.
creator: Filip.L_Ecluse@alcatel.be

text:
It was the intention to ensure that sample labels were set from the sampler
names, and I thought I had fixed that in CVS HEAD. I'll have a look at that
again soon.

Using the sampler name as the label is also needed for the Aggregate Listener.

=

If the URL is also needed, it should be made available as a separate sample
attribute (there may already be some code to do that).
creator: sebb@apache.org
woolfel@yahoo.com

text:
Just downloaded the code and it works OK for me with HTTP sampler against
www.apache.org.

What do you get in the View Results in Table Listener?

However, when automatically downloading embedded resources, the label does get
changed to the URL - that can be fixed.
creator: sebb@apache.org
